DOC.brief_summary: The primary purpose of this study was to assess the effectiveness of omega-3 supplementation on behavior problems in children.
DOC.brief_title: Effect of Omega-3 Supplementation on Child Behavior Problems
DOC.detailed_description: This study consists of a randomized, placebo-controlled, double-blind trial of omega-3 on behavior problems in children. All behavior problem outcomes were assessed, although the primary focus was on antisocial and aggressive behavior.
DOC.criteria: child age between 8 and 16 years residing in the community fish allergy diagnosed mental disorder mental retardation on medication that may modify lipid metabolism extensive use of nutritional supplements within the previous 3 months
